CatDescriptText: Cutline of related images published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 20, 1941, pg. 24, reads: "FORT PITT YULETIDE PARTY IN NORSE ROOM GIVEN FOR NEGRO WORKERS - Leroy Brown and his orchestra provided the music and William Harris, manager of the Fort Pitt Hotel, gave brief remarks during the annual Christmas banquet and dance for the hotel's race workers. The 1941 version of the affair was one of the best to date.  Top left photo (2001.35.39925) shows one of the guest tables.  Seated are: Mr.and Mrs. Robert Donell, Mrs. Roosevelt Gloster, Roosevelt Gloster, Banquet Captain, and one of the hosts of the party, Charles Porter, James Hays, entertainer, who with Billy Alston as Emcee, put on a comical skit.  The lower left photo shows the hosts for the evening of gaiety, left to right, Andrew Fulton, lounge bar captain; Clarence Bruce, head waiter, and Roosevelt Gloster, banquet captain.  The right picture (2001.35.39921) shows more of the guests and employees. Left to right are: Mr. and Mrs. Clarence Bruce, Mr. and Mrs. Othur Taylor, and C.E. Bruce and company. - (Harris photo). "
TitMainTitle: Four men, including one left wearing tuxedo, and four women, gathered around table in Norse Room in Fort Pitt Hotel for hotel employee Christmas party
